intro: Adenocalymma scabriusculum, commonly known as the rough-stemmed adenocalymma, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Its rough, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers make it easily identifiable in its native habitat. Adenocalymma scabriusculum is often found in dry, open environments and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
